intro: Crepis keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in a single head, surrounded by bracts. Crepis keniensis is often found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native environment.
